title: Getting Started with Linked Data Explorer
subtitle: Learn how to discover, orchestrate, and execute DMN chains for Dutch Government services

tutorials.title: Quick Start: Heusdenpas Chain Demo
tutorials.description: Follow this step-by-step guide to run your first DMN chain execution

steps.title: View Available Content
steps.description: Start by exploring the available DMN models in the system.
steps.action: Open https://linkeddata.open-regels.nl/
details: The landing page shows the SPARQL Query Editor
This view connects to TriplyDB where DMN metadata is stored
You'll use this to discover available decision models
steps.tip: ðŸ’¡ The 'Run Query' button executes the current SPARQL query to retrieve data

steps.title: Execute Discovery Query
steps.description: Click the 'Run Query' button in the upper right corner to retrieve available DMNs.
steps.action: Click 'Run Query' button
details: This executes a SPARQL query against TriplyDB
Results show DMN models with their metadata
You'll see identifiers, names, and available variables
steps.tip: ðŸ’¡ Sample queries are available in the left panel for different discovery scenarios

steps.title: Switch to Orchestration View
steps.description: Navigate to the DMN Orchestration interface where you can build chains.
steps.action: Click the GitBranch icon (ðŸ”€) in the left sidebar
details: The Orchestration view has three panels:
â€¢ Left: Available DMNs you can drag
steps.tip: ðŸ’¡ The sidebar icons represent different views: Query Editor, Orchestration, Visualization, and Changelog

steps.title: Observe Available DMNs
steps.description: Check the left panel to see the DMN models loaded from TriplyDB.
steps.action: Review the DMN list in the left panel
details: You should see 6 DMN models available
steps.tip: ðŸ’¡ DMNs with matching input/output variables can be chained together

steps.title: Load Preset Configuration
steps.description: Use a pre-configured chain to see how DMN orchestration works.
steps.action: In the right panel, find and click 'Heusdenpas Chain' preset
details: The preset loads three DMNs in the correct order:
These appear in the middle panel as a chain
steps.tip: ðŸ’¡ Presets are shortcuts for common workflows you might use frequently

steps.title: Fill Test Data
steps.description: Populate input fields with sample data for testing.
steps.action: Scroll down in the right panel and click 'Fill with test data (3 DMNs)'
details: All required inputs are automatically filled
steps.tip: ðŸ’¡ You can manually edit any input field after filling test data

steps.title: Review Configuration
steps.description: Examine the prefilled inputs in the Chain Configuration section.
steps.action: Review the input fields in the right panel
details: The validation section shows chain is ready to execute
steps.tip: ðŸ’¡ Missing inputs will be highlighted with warnings in the validation section

steps.title: Execute the Chain
steps.description: Run the DMN chain to see automated eligibility determination.
steps.action: Click the 'Execute Chain' button
details: 1. Calls Operaton DMN engine for each model
2. Passes outputs as inputs to next DMN
3. Collects all results and intermediate steps
steps.tip: ðŸ’¡ Watch the execution progress indicator to see each DMN being processed

steps.title: Review Results
steps.description: Examine the execution results and eligibility determinations.
steps.action: Browse through the results shown in the right panel
details: â€¢ Intermediate outputs from each DMN
â€¢ Complete variable tracing through the chain
steps.tip: ðŸ’¡ The step-by-step breakdown shows how data flows between DMNs

steps.title: Clear and Rebuild
steps.description: Learn how to start fresh and build chains manually.
steps.action: Click 'Clear Chain' button
details: This removes all DMNs from the chain
You're ready to build a new chain
steps.tip: ðŸ’¡ Clearing the chain is useful when you want to start over or test different configurations

tutorials.title: Building Chains Manually
tutorials.description: Learn to create custom DMN chains using drag-and-drop

steps.title: Drag First DMN
steps.description: Start building your chain by dragging a DMN to the composer.
steps.action: Drag 'SVB_LeeftijdsInformatie' from left panel to middle panel
details: Click and hold on the DMN card
Drag it to the drop zone in the middle
Release to add it to your chain
The DMN appears as the first step
steps.tip: ðŸ’¡ The order matters! Start with DMNs that have fewer input requirements

steps.title: Add Second DMN
steps.description: Continue building by adding the next decision model.
steps.action: Drag 'SZW_BijstandsnormInformatie' below the first DMN
details: Look for output variables from SVB that match SZW inputs
Age and date outputs from SVB feed into SZW
The chain validates automatically as you build
Variable matching is shown in the validation panel
steps.tip: ðŸ’¡ Green checkmarks in validation indicate successful variable matching

steps.title: Complete the Chain
steps.description: Add the final DMN to complete the workflow.
steps.action: Drag 'RONL_HeusdenpasEindresultaat' as the third step
details: This DMN receives outputs from both previous steps
The complete chain now processes eligibility end-to-end
steps.tip: ðŸ’¡ Watch the validation panel update as each DMN is added

steps.title: Reorder DMNs
steps.description: Learn how chain order affects execution and validation.
steps.action: Try dragging a DMN to a different position in the chain
details: Click and drag any DMN card up or down
Correct order ensures proper data flow
steps.tip: ðŸ’¡ The validation panel explains why certain orders don't work

steps.title: Fill Incremental Test Data
steps.description: Use test data that adapts to your current chain configuration.
steps.action: Scroll to inputs and click 'Fill with test data' button
details: Test data adapts to the DMNs in your chain
Works for partial chains (1, 2, or 3 DMNs)
steps.tip: ðŸ’¡ The button text shows how many DMNs will get test data

steps.title: Execute Your Custom Chain
steps.description: Run your manually built chain to verify it works.
steps.action: Click 'Execute Chain' and review results
details: Execution follows the order you created
Each DMN receives outputs from previous steps
Results show the complete execution trace
steps.tip: ðŸ’¡ Compare results with the preset to verify correctness

steps.title: Understand Chain Validity
steps.description: Learn what makes a chain valid or invalid.
steps.action: Review the validation section in the right panel
details: Required inputs are listed with their sources
steps.tip: ðŸ’¡ You cannot execute chains with validation errors

tutorials.title: Understanding DMN Models
tutorials.description: Learn about Decision Model and Notation in government workflows

steps.title: What is a DMN?
steps.description: Decision Model and Notation (DMN) is a standard for modeling decision logic.
steps.action: Review the DMN cards in the left panel
details: DMNs encode government rules and policies
They take inputs and produce deterministic outputs
Examples: age calculation, eligibility checks, benefit amounts
RONL uses DMNs to automate legal decisions
steps.tip: ðŸ’¡ DMNs make government decisions transparent and auditable

steps.title: Input Variables
steps.description: Inputs are the data a DMN needs to make decisions.
steps.action: Look at the blue tags on DMN cards
details: Each input has a specific data type
steps.tip: ðŸ’¡ Input variable names help identify what data is needed

steps.title: Output Variables
steps.description: Outputs are the decisions or calculated values produced by a DMN.
steps.action: Look at the green tags on DMN cards
details: Outputs can become inputs for other DMNs
steps.tip: ðŸ’¡ Chaining works when output types match input types

steps.title: DMN Metadata
steps.description: Understanding the information stored about each DMN.
steps.action: Examine a DMN card's complete information
details: Metadata comes from TriplyDB via CPRMV vocabulary
steps.tip: ðŸ’¡ The identifier is used to reference DMNs in chains

steps.title: Variable Matching
steps.description: How the system determines which DMNs can be chained.
steps.action: Try adding incompatible DMNs to see validation errors
details: â€¢ Output variable names must match input names
â€¢ Data types must be compatible
â€¢ Required inputs must have sources
steps.tip: ðŸ’¡ Good DMN design uses consistent variable naming

steps.title: Real-World Example
steps.description: How the Heusdenpas chain works in practice.
steps.action: Review the preset chain configuration
details: Step 1 (SVB): Calculates age from birth date
Step 2 (SZW): Checks benefit eligibility using age
This automates what civil servants do manually
steps.tip: ðŸ’¡ DMN chains can replace complex manual workflows

tutorials.title: Advanced Features
tutorials.description: Explore additional capabilities of the Linked Data Explorer

steps.title: SPARQL Query Editor
steps.description: Learn to write custom queries for DMN discovery.
steps.action: Switch to the Query Editor view (first icon in sidebar)
details: Sample queries are available in the left panel
You can modify queries to filter or sort DMNs
Results can be viewed as tables or graphs
steps.tip: ðŸ’¡ Use the sample queries as templates for your own queries

steps.title: Graph Visualization
steps.description: Visualize DMN relationships as an interactive graph.
steps.action: Switch to Visualization view (third icon in sidebar)
details: After running a query, switch to this view
Zoom and pan to navigate large graphs
steps.tip: ðŸ’¡ Graph view helps understand complex DMN relationships

steps.title: Custom Endpoints
steps.description: Configure different SPARQL endpoints for various data sources.
steps.action: Click the Settings icon (gear) in the sidebar
details: You can add custom SPARQL endpoints
Switch between TriplyDB and other sources
Useful for testing against different datasets
steps.tip: ðŸ’¡ Keep the default TriplyDB endpoint for production DMN data

steps.title: Execution Performance
steps.description: Understanding and monitoring chain execution times.
steps.action: Execute a chain and review the timing information
details: Each DMN execution is timed separately
Total chain time includes orchestration overhead
steps.tip: ðŸ’¡ Execution time is shown in the results panel

steps.title: Version History
steps.description: Track application updates and new features.
steps.action: Click the Changelog icon (book) in the sidebar
details: Organized by version with collapsible sections
steps.tip: ðŸ’¡ Check the changelog after deployments to see what's new

steps.title: Error Handling
steps.description: Understanding and troubleshooting execution errors.
steps.action: Try executing a chain with invalid inputs to see error messages
details: Error messages guide you to solutions
steps.tip: ðŸ’¡ Read error messages carefully - they usually explain the fix needed

steps.title: Browser Developer Tools
steps.description: Use browser tools for debugging and deeper insights.
steps.action: Open browser DevTools (F12 or Right-click â†’ Inspect)
details: Network tab displays API calls to backend
Can see raw JSON request/response data
steps.tip: ðŸ’¡ Console logs show variable mapping and orchestration details

tutorials.title: Troubleshooting Guide
tutorials.description: Common issues and how to resolve them

steps.title: No DMNs Loading
steps.description: When the DMN list is empty in orchestration view.
steps.action: Check backend connectivity
details: Verify you're connected to the internet
Check that backend is running (ACC environment)
Look for error messages in the console
steps.tip: ðŸ’¡ The backend must be reachable for DMN discovery

steps.title: Chain Validation Errors
steps.description: Chain shows as invalid and won't execute.
steps.action: Review the validation panel messages
details: Verify DMN order matches variable flow
Ensure all input fields are filled
Try using the preset as reference
steps.tip: ðŸ’¡ Each validation message explains what's wrong

steps.title: Execution Failures
steps.description: Chain executes but returns errors.
steps.action: Check the error message in results panel
details: Review error details and try again
steps.tip: ðŸ’¡ Error messages often include the specific DMN that failed

steps.title: Slow Execution
steps.description: Chain takes longer than expected to execute.
steps.action: Monitor execution timing in results
details: â€¢ Number of DMNs in chain
steps.tip: ðŸ’¡ Performance is expected to improve in future releases

steps.title: UI Display Issues
steps.description: Visual or layout problems in the interface.
steps.action: Try these steps
details: Check browser console for JavaScript errors
steps.tip: ðŸ’¡ The app works best in modern browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Edge)

steps.title: Getting Help
steps.description: Where to find additional support and resources.
steps.action: Use available support channels
details: â€¢ GitLab Issues for bug reports
steps.tip: ðŸ’¡ Include error messages and screenshots when reporting issues
